title: 103_s884
content: SECTION 1. COOPERATIVE EDUCATION. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965 regarding reservations for continuation awards and clarification on grant recipients' subsequent participation. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965 related to grant recipients' subsequent participation and the calculation of the 10-year period preceding the grant request date. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include a rule stating that institutions can receive grants after a 10-year period following their last grant. Priority is given to institutions that have received grant funds in the previous fiscal year. The Higher Education Act of 1965 now allows institutions to receive grant funds after a 10-year period, with priority given to those who received grants in the previous fiscal year. The federal share of funds is further amended to include special rules regarding waivers for institutions of higher education. The Higher Education Act of 1965 allows institutions to receive grant funds with waivers for the federal share provisions under certain conditions. The availability of appropriations is also limited regarding student compensation. Appropriations under this title shall not be available for student compensation for employment by employers under arrangements. Funds appropriated for fiscal year 1993 will remain available for obligation until September 30, 1994. SEC. 2. GRADUATE PROGRAMS. If an individual received multiyear fellowship assistance under certain parts of the Higher Education Act of 1965 in fiscal year 1992, the Secretary of Education shall apply the provisions of such parts for the remainder of the duration of the fellowship assistance. SEC. 3. PACIFIC REGIONAL EDUCATIONAL LABORATORY. SEC. 3. PACIFIC REGIONAL EDUCATIONAL LABORATORY. The section amends the Carl D. Perkins Vocational and Applied Technology Education Act to rename the Center for the Advancement of Pacific Education to the Pacific Regional Educational Laboratory in Honolulu, Hawaii. It also allows for direct services regarding grants for educational programs. Section 232 of the Carl D. Perkins Vocational and Applied Technology Education Act is amended to include "or consortia" in various subsections, expanding the scope of institutions eligible for grants. In subsection (c), paragraph (1) now includes "or consortium" after "institution", and paragraph (2) includes "or consortia" after "institutions". SEC. 5. NATIONAL BOARD FOR PROFESSIONAL TEACHING STANDARDS. Section 551 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include a Matching Funds Requirement for financial assistance provided to the Board. The Board must agree to expend non-Federal contributions equal to $1 for every $1 of Federal funds provided. The Board must use non-Federal funds raised after January 1, 1987 for various purposes related to national teacher assessment and certification procedures under this subpart. The Senate passed the legislation on May 4, 1993. Walter J. Stewart attested to the document as Secretary.
